pr_title: [PERF] Context logs : postpone String building and check log level

timeline.bodyText: In that specific case, a simple concatenation should be more efficient. What do you think?

timeline.bodyText: @lcosson I think there is no reason to create a Supplier here
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Are you sure they are public?
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: I think adding a check for log level enabled before a call with string constants does not offer performance improvement, the log library will do the same check in the implementation (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8788096/log-info-using-log-isinfoenabled). Personally I prefer removing the check for such one-line calls, to improve readability.
timeline.author: zamarrenolm

replies.bodyText: I see your point, but then it's like for the partial use of Suppliers with @mathbagu : what's the policy ? Should we say "prefer doing stuff that way in general" or "work on a case by case basis" ?
replies.author: lcosson

replies.bodyText: Looking to the code of logback, the log methods use a chain of filter to define to decide if a LogEvent has to be created. There are two different implementation of LogFilter, and in that case, the TurboFilter are used. These filters have to be really fast. So I think, we can follow Luma's advice.
replies.author: mathbagu
